title: Bianca King
text:
Bianca Charlotte King-Wintle (born 18 March 1985) is a <a href="Filipinos">Filipina</a>-<a href="United%20Kingdom">British</a> former actress, model, music video director and host best known for playing the role as Noemi Manansala in the thriller drama series "<a href="Sinner%20or%20Saint%20%28TV%20series%29">Sinner or Saint</a>" (2011), as Aviona in the hit "fantaserye" "<a href="Mulawin">Mulawin</a>" (2004), as well as her first lead prime time soap, "<a href="Luna%20Blanca">Luna Blanca</a>" (2012), where in she played the title role of black-skinned Luna.
King starred in the afternoon drama "<a href="Maghihintay%20Pa%20Rin">Maghihintay Pa Rin</a>" of <a href="GMA%20Network">GMA Network</a> with <a href="Rafael%20Rosell">Rafael Rosell</a> and <a href="Dion%20Ignacio">Dion Ignacio</a>.
She went to San Beda College Alabang during her grade school and high school years. She proceeded to take up AB Digital Filmmaking in De La Salle - College of St. Benilde and is a music video director.
King's biggest breaks where "<a href="Sinner%20or%20Saint%20%28TV%20series%29">Sinner or Saint</a>" in 2011 and "<a href="Broken%20Vow%20%28TV%20series%29">Broken Vow</a>" in 2012. In 2014, she transferred to <a href="5%20%28TV%20channel%29">TV5</a> where she started in the Tuesday primetime drama <a href="Obsession%20%28TV%20series%29">Obsession</a> with Marvin Agustin and Neri Naig and Elizabeth Oropesa and got another main role in comedy show "<a href="Mac%20and%20Chiz">Mac and Chiz</a>" and hosted TV5’s "<a href="Showbiz%20Konek%20na%20Konek">Showbiz Konek na Konek</a>". In 2017, she came back to television on ABS-CBN's "<a href="Pusong%20Ligaw">Pusong Ligaw</a>" as her first soap with the network since her transfer. According to King, she did not tell anyone about her transfer, but only to former co-star Iza Calzado, a former GMA Television artist.
Biography.
Early life and career beginnings.
King's career started at the age of 13, when she began modeling for print ads and TV commercials. She did ads for a deodorant, beverage and hotdogs brands, to name a few.
Career.
2004–2014: "Mulawin" and supporting roles.
In 2004, King was first cast as part of the last batch of "<a href="Click%20%28Philippine%20TV%20series%29">Click</a>", where she played the role of a golden-hearted balikbayan, Marnie. Her on-screen partner was Warren Austria, whose claim to fame is his shampoo commercial. Bianca was joined by then the winners of <a href="StarStruck%20%28Season%201%29">first season</a> of <a href="StarStruck%20%28Philippine%20TV%20series%29">StarStruck</a> who were <a href="Mark%20Herras">Mark Herras</a>, <a href="Jennylyn%20Mercado">Jennylyn Mercado</a>, <a href="Yasmien%20Kurdi">Yasmien Kurdi</a> and <a href="Rainier%20Castillo">Rainier Castillo</a>. After her role on "Click", King was cast as part of one of the "Fantaseryes" of the network which was "<a href="Mulawin">Mulawin</a>" led by <a href="Richard%20Gutierrez">Richard Gutierrez</a> as Aguiluz and <a href="Angel%20Locsin">Angel Locsin</a> as Alwina. King played the role of Aviona, a female warrior who was secretly in love to Mulawin. Before landing a lead role in 2011, Mulawin was considered to be her biggest break as she was one of the lead casts together with Gutierrez, Locsin and <a href="Dennis%20Trillo">Dennis Trillo</a>. According to her, she consider that moment the "turning point" of her career because she was "able to show off her talent purely in acting".
In 2005, King also tried her hosting skills via the gender-sensitive magazine show "3R" together with <a href="Iza%20Calzado">Iza Calzado</a>, <a href="Bettina%20Carlos">Bettina Carlos</a> and <a href="Chynna%20Ortaleza">Chynna Ortaleza</a>. King was also part of the sixth season of the youth-oriented romance-based show, <a href="Love%20to%20Love%20%28TV%20series%29">Love to Love</a>, entitled "<a href="Love%20to%20Love%20%28TV%20series%29">Wish Upon a Jar</a>" starring <a href="Yasmien%20Kurdi">Yasmien Kurdi</a> and <a href="Rainier%20Castillo">Rainier Castillo</a>. She also got her break in the silver screen via the independent film, "Birhen ng Manaoag" led by <a href="Jodi%20Sta.%20Maria">Jodi Sta. Maria</a>. She played the role of Marie, the daughter of the character of <a href="Cherrie%20Pie%20Picache">Cherrie Pie Picache</a>. She also got a role in the movie "Hari ng Sablay" led by <a href="Bearwin%20Meily">Bearwin Meily</a> as Monica. In December 2005, King was part of 2 of the 8 film entries in the <a href="2005%20Metro%20Manila%20Film%20Festival">2005 Metro Manila Film Festival</a>. She reprise her role of Aviona in the of "Mulawin" wherein the film stood as the television series' sequel. Aside from her role as Aviona, King was also part in the fourth installment of one of <a href="Regal%20Films">Regal Films</a>' most successful movie franchises, "". Aside from her "Mano Po" appearance, Regal Films also made King to be part of "<a href="I%20Will%20Always%20Love%20You%20%28film%29">I Will Always Love You</a>" starred by <a href="Richard%20Gutierrez">Richard Gutierrez</a> and <a href="Angel%20Locsin">Angel Locsin</a>. She was also hand picked by <a href="Mark%20Meily">Mark Meily</a> to star in the short film, "The Sugar Affair".
In 2006, King was signed up by <a href="Bench%20%28Philippine%20clothing%20brand%29">Herbench</a> to endorse their summer line. One of the leading men's magazine in the Philippines featured Bianca twice on their cover, the first through their September 2005 and again on the June 2006 issue. Bianca was voted as one of FHM's 100 sexiest women several times.
King was also chosen by Bench to be one of the main endorsers of the "Bench Fever: Underwear Fashion Show 2006". Her billboards were scattered all over the metropolis and she wowed the crowd onstage that day at the <a href="Araneta%20Coliseum">Big Dome</a>. She had a cameo role in <a href="Rufa%20Mae%20Quinto">Rufa Mae Quinto</a>'s "Oh My Ghost!" under OctoArts Films and was part of GMA Network's multi-million underwater fantasy series, "<a href="Atlantika">Atlantika</a>".
King was once again became a part of "Love 2 Love" opposite "StarStruck" winner, <a href="Mark%20Herras">Mark Herras</a>, in the series entitled "<a href="Love%20to%20Love%20%28TV%20series%29">My Darling Mermaid</a>" as Patty and in the last installment entitled "<a href="Love%20to%20Love%20%28TV%20series%29">Jass Got Lucky</a>" led by <a href="Lovi%20Poe">Lovi Poe</a> and <a href="Cogie%20Domingo">Cogie Domingo</a>.
In 2007, she was part of the success of the phenomenal television hit, "<a href="MariMar%20%28Philippine%20TV%20series%29">MariMar</a>", where she played Natalia Montenegro. After her "MariMar" role, she landed a role in one of the casts of "<a href="Sine%20Novela">Sine Novela</a>": "<a href="My%20Only%20Love">My Only Love</a>". The said remake was led by <a href="Rhian%20Ramos">Rhian Ramos</a> and <a href="Mark%20Herras">Mark Herras</a>. Bianca King also starred in <a href="GMA%20Network">GMA Network</a>'s telefantasya, "<a href="Dyesebel%20%282008%20TV%20series%29">Dyesebel</a>", which she worked with <a href="Marian%20Rivera">Marian Rivera</a> for the third time since "MariMar" and "<a href="Super%20Twins">Super Twins</a>".
2009–2014: Directorial debut and further projects.
In early 2009, King was cast as one of the leading ladies of Richard Gutierrez's character in the <a href="Zorro%20%28Philippines%20TV%20series%29">Philippine adaptation</a> of "<a href="Zorro">Zorro</a>" together with <a href="Rhian%20Ramos">Rhian Ramos</a> and <a href="Michelle%20Madrigal">Michelle Madrigal</a>. She was also part in the first story under <a href="SRO%20Cinemaserye">SRO Cinemaserye</a> series, "Ganti". She co-starred with <a href="Marvin%20Agustin">Marvin Agustin</a>, <a href="Sheryl%20Cruz">Sheryl Cruz</a> and <a href="Geoff%20Eigenmann">Geoff Eigenmann</a>. For the <a href="2009%20Metro%20Manila%20Film%20Festival">2009 Metro Manila Film Festival</a>, King was part of the film entry "<a href="Wapakman">Wapakman</a>" led by the boxing champ, <a href="Manny%20Pacquiao">Manny Pacquiao</a>.
The year 2009 marked Bianca King's directorial debut through <a href="Hale%20%28band%29">Hale</a>'s first single in their <a href="Kundiman%20%28album%29">fourth album</a>, "Bahay Kubo". <a href="GMA%20Network">GMA Network</a> also gave Bianca the director's job for <a href="Frencheska%20Farr">Frencheska Farr</a>'s debut single, "<a href="Inside%20My%20Heart">Today I'll See The Sun</a>". Both songs directed by King were able to be in the hit charts in the local music scenes.
During the first quarter of 2010, King was cast in "<a href="The%20Last%20Prince">The Last Prince</a>". She portrayed the role of Bawana, the one who loved Prinsipe Almiro/Haring Almiro (Abrenica) but the latter chose to love Lara Fernandez (Bernal).
In 2013, she starred in her last project with the network, "<a href="Maghihintay%20Pa%20Rin">Maghihintay Pa Rin</a>".
Move to TV5 (2014–2016).
She signed an exclusive contract with <a href="5%20%28TV%20channel%29">TV5</a> after thirteen years being a Kapuso. She started getting main roles in "<a href="Obsession%20%28TV%20series%29">Obsession</a>" and "<a href="Mac%20and%20Chiz">Mac and Chiz</a>" and started her hosting career in "<a href="Showbiz%20Konek%20na%20Konek">Showbiz Konek na Konek</a>". She stayed with the Kapatid Network until 2016.
Transferring to ABS-CBN: Pusong Ligaw and others (2016–2019).
She left TV5 after two years and moved to <a href="ABS-CBN">ABS-CBN</a>, she was cast in "<a href="Pusong%20Ligaw">Pusong Ligaw</a>" as her first major project in the network and became a performer on "<a href="ASAP%20%28TV%20program%29">ASAP</a>". In 2018–2019, she starred as Aliyah Torres in an extended stint on "<a href="Halik%20%28TV%20series%29">Halik</a>".
